definitions.body: infr.) (´[[י]] is salvation, or ´[[י]] is opulence, cf. [[אֱלִישָׁע]], [[אֱלִישׁוּעַ]], [[אֲבִישׁוּעַ]] & Nes:SK 1892, 573 f.; in any case it came to be associated with [[ישׁע]], cf. Mt 1:21; on [[יֵשׁוּעַ]] v. esp. Frä:VOJ iv. 1890, 332 f. Müll:SK 1892, 177 f. who cite analog. for change of [[וׂ]] to later [[]]—[[ֵ]], & Nes:l. c.)—

Moses’ successor, son of Nun, (LXX ) Ihsou=v) [[יְהוֹשׁוּעַ]] De 3:21, Ju Jdg 2:7; = [[יְהוֹשֻׁעַ]] Ex 17:9, Ex 17:10, Ex 17:13, Ex 17:14, Ex 24:13, Ex 32:17, Ex 33:11, Nu 11:28, Nu 13:16, Nu 14:6, Nu 14:30, Nu 14:38, Nu 26:65, Nu 27:18, Nu 27:22, Nu 32:12, Nu 32:28, Nu 34:17, De 1:38, De 3:28, De 31:3, De 31:7, De 31:14, De 31:14, De 31:23, De 34:9, Jos 1:1 + 167 t. Jos; Ju Jdg 1:1, Jdg 2:6, Jdg 2:7, Jdg 2:8, Jdg 2:21, Jdg 2:23, 1Ki 16:34, 1Ch 7:27; = [[יֵשׁוּעַ]] Ne 8:17 (LXX )Ihsou=v); acc. to P, name changed by Moses fr. [[הוֹשֵׁעַ]] q.v. Nu 13:8, Nu 13:16 (LXX Au(sh) De 32:44 (LXX )Ihsou=v). †
[[יְהוֹשֻׁעַ]] a Bethshemite 1Sa 6:14, 1Sa 6:18 (LXX (Wshe, A )Ihsou=v, LXXL )Iwshe). †

h. p. after the restoration, son of Jehozadak [[יְהוֹשֻׁעַ]] (LXX )Ihsou=v) Hag 1:1, Hag 1:12, Hag 1:14, Hag 2:2, Hag 2:4, Zec 3:1, Zec 3:3, Zec 3:6, Zec 3:8, Zec 3:9, Zec 6:11; = [[יְשׁוּעַ]] (LXX )Ihsou=v) Ezr 2:2, Ezr 3:2, Ezr 3:8, Ezr 4:3, Ezr 5:2, Ezr 10:18, Ne 7:7, Ne 12:1, Ne 12:7, Ne 12:10, Ne 12:26. †
[[יְהוֹשֻׁעַ]] governor of Jerusalem under Josiah 2Ki 23:8 (LXX )Ihsou=v, LXXL )Iwshe). †
[[יֵשׁוּעַ]] (LXX )Ihsou=v). head of one of the classes of priests 1Ch 24:11, possibly also Ezr 2:36 = Ne 7:39. †
[[יֵשׁוּעַ]] (LXX )Ihsou=v etc.), a Levitical family-name of frequent occurrence:
[[יֵשׁוּעַ]] (LXX id.), father of a builder at the wall Ne 3:19, perh. = †
a Judaite family-name (LXX id.), Ezr 2:6 = Ne 7:11 (cf. Sm:Listen 12). †
